title: United beat Fire 4-0
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest United beat Fire 4-0 Pontius opened the scoring when he pushed the ball past Chicago's Jon Busch with a heavy touch to finish in the open net Post to Facebook United beat Fire 4-0 Pontius opened the scoring when he pushed the ball past Chicago's Jon Busch with a heavy touch to finish in the open net  //on.wusa9.com/1RQZLB1   Join the Conversation To   United beat Fire 4-0 Associated Press, AP 1:42 a.m. EDT October 19, 2015 Oct 18, 2015; Washington, DC, USA; D.C. United midfielder/forward Chris Pontius (13) dribbles the ball past Chicago Fire defender/midfielder Joevin Jones (3) and Fire defender Matt Polster (2) in the first half at Robert F. Kennedy Memorial. Mandatory Credit: Geoff Burke-USA TODAY Sports (Photo: Geoff Burke, Geoff Burke-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
WASHINGTON (AP) - Chris Pontius scored in the 39th minute and D.C. United added three second-half goals to beat the Chicago Fire 4-0 on Sunday. 
United (15-12-6, 51 points) moved into second place in the East and can secure an automatic berth in the conference semifinals with a win over the Columbus Crew in the regular-season finale next Sunday. 
Pontius opened the scoring when he pushed the ball past Chicago's Jon Busch with a heavy touch and raced behind the goalkeeper to finish in the open net. 
Bobby Boswell headed home Fabian Espindola's corner in the 67th minute, Espindola knocked in a left-footer with the benefit of defender Lovel Palmer's deflection in the 71st, and Alvaro Saborio volleyed in a high-arching deflection from point-blank range in the 80th. 
The Fire dropped to 8-19-6. Read or Share this story: http://on.wusa9.com/1RQZLB1 TOP VIDEOS
